openerSection: The AU Small Finance Bank Altura Credit Card is a basic cashback credit card that allows you to save a lot as you get a cashback on almost every purchase you make. As a welcome benefit, you get a 5% cashback on your retail spends done within the first 2 months from the card activation date. Moreover, you can earn a cashback of up to 2% on all your spends, which is directly credited to your account. Along with the regular cashback, you can earn Rs. 50 cashback additionally every month under the card's milestone benefits.

Keeping its customers' travel needs in mind, the card also provides them with complimentary access to selected railway lounges in India. You can also save more by getting your joining and renewal fee waived off on the basis of your spends. To know more about the Altura Credit Card by AU Small Finance bank, check the detailed information given below:

openerSection: The AU Small Finance LIT Credit Card is India's First customizable Credit card in terms of features. This means that you can choose whatever feature you want on your card and just pay for the same and nothing else. The AU bank has launched a very innovative and only one of its kind credit card. Every other credit card company launches many credit cards with different features and benefits. There are many credit cards in the market with different features and therefore it becomes very difficult and confusing for the customers to choose the best card to fulfil their needs from so many cards. The customer often end up having multiple cards, paying multiple fees every year. The AU bank took the first mover advantage of this and launched the first ever feature customizing credit card, the LIT credit card. The bank has launched many other cards with many great benefits, but the LIT card has very unique features.

The LIT credit card comes with so many features to select from, and with so many benefits. The cardholder can simply log on to the AU 0101 App and select the feature they want to use for next 90 Days and just pay for it. The Card offers great ways to earn many reward points, like 1 Reward Point for every Rs. 100 spent on retail and 10X or 5X accelerated Reward Points on the feature that you select. On top of that, the card offers great cashback benefits on the specific feature you select for. Not only this, the card offer free memberships to premium brands like Zee5, Amazon prime and more. For travelers the card offers great cashbacks offers and complimentary access to airport lounges. Just select the feature you want, pay for it and enjoy the benefits and privileges.
Let's explore more about this Innovative card by AU with the detailed review below:

openerSection: In an attempt to capitalize on the exponential growth in online transactions owing to the increasing internet penetration in the country, even more so during the pandemic, Axis bank launched their ACE credit card in a partnership with Google Pay and Visa. openerSection: Just a few months after Amazon partnered with ICICI Bank to launch the Amazon Pay credit card, Flipkart and Axis Bank came up with their cobranded card in July 2019 namely Flipkart Axis Bank Credit Card. A card is a great option for those who love shopping on Flipkart and Myntra as it offers 5% cash back on purchases made on them. Not only this, but the card also offers great cashback on certain merchants like Swiggy, Uber, PVR, and cure. fit and also offers cashback on another spending. Apart from shopping, it also offers other benefits like travel where you can get complimentary access to domestic lounges and other benefits in dining, fuel, and much more.

Initially, the Flipkart Axis Bank Card was launched as a Mastercard variant but after the RBI ban, Axis bank issued the card as Visa Variant. The Visa variant was offered as a lifetime free card, however, with effect from 5th January 2021, a membership fee of Rs. 500 (plus taxes) is applicable. Continue reading to learn more about Flipkart Axis Credit Card and see how it stacks up against the Amazon Pay ICICI Credit Card.

openerSection: IndianOil Axis Bank Credit Card is a co-branded fuel credit card issued by Axis Bank in collaboration with IOCL (Indian Oil Corporation Limited). The card is solely aimed at providing great saving opportunities to those who spend very often on fuel. It is an entry-level card and hence comes with a nominal annual fee of Rs. 500. The card offers a particularly high reward rate of 5% on fuel spends at IOCL filling stations and a decent reward rate of 1% on online spends.

Bening an entry-level credit card, although it doesn't offer many additional benefits, you however do get dining and movie benefits with instant discounts on movie tickets and discounted rates at partner restaurants under the bank's Dining Deleghts Program. Other than this, the cardholders get fuel surcharge waivers and many more benefits with the IndianOil Axis Bank Credit Card. openerSection: Axis Bank launched the Magnus credit card in September 2019, which is issued in both, MasterCard & Visa credit card networks. It is a super-premium card issued by the bank and is targeted at high-income individuals who want to enjoy the privilege of a luxurious lifestyle. From dining and travel to medical and insurance benefits, the card comes packed with all kinds of privileges that one can expect from a premium credit card. At 3% pm, the interest rate for this card is also low, and keeping in mind the international transaction needs of their premium customers, the bank has also kept the Forex Mark up fee fairly low ( just 2%).

Moreover, there are no cash withdrawal charges on the card (Interest charges applicable). Although the annual fee of the card is quite high, you can get it waived off by spending 15 lakhs or above in the previous anniversary year and save Rs. 10,000. openerSection: Axis Bank Miles & More Credit Card is a travel credit card best suited for international frequent flyers. The card comes in two variants- Axis Bank Miles & More Select Credit Card and Axis Bank Miles & More World Credit Card. The Select variant is the more premium one of the two and therefore offers a higher reward rate and comes with a higher membership fee.

You earn award miles on all categories of spends with the Miles & More Card which are added to your Miles & More account registered with the bank. These award miles can be redeemed for travel spends, shopping at partner merchants, or can be donated for a cause you care for.

Apart from the award miles, you also get many other additional benefits including complimentary domestic and international airport lounge access, discounts on dining bills, insurance covers and a 24×7 concierge service with the Miles & More Credit Card.

openerSection: If you are looking for an entry-level card, IDFC's FIRST Millennia credit card is the right choice for you. This is a reward points-based credit card with a decent rewards program. It offers up to 10x Non-Expiring Reward points which can be redeemed at any point in time, that too without paying any redemption charges. This card provides reward points on online as well as offline spending. Moreover, if someone is fond of traveling via trains, then this card provides complimentary Railway Lounge access four times a quarter making your traveling experience a lot more luxurious.

Other card benefits include a discount of up to 25% on movies, up to 20% off on dining, complimentary roadside assistance, and many more. openerSection: Bank of Baroda Prime credit card is a popular secured credit card (i.e. card against fixed deposit) offered by BoB Financial, the financial services-related company owned by Bank of Baroda. The Prime credit card is issued against an FD of Rs 15,000 or more and no income proof is required. This card is a lifetime free credit card, i.e, you don't need to pay any annual changes to avail of its benefits. You get 4 Rewards on every Rs 100 spent (equivalent to 1% cashback) on all categories. These points can easily be redeemed against a lot of exclusive options including shopping, gift vouchers, etc.

There are many more advantages associated with the Bank Of Baroda Prime credit card such as accidental insurance cover, fuel surcharge waiver, zero liability cover, etc. It is a great option for those who don't have a credit history as they can build their credit by using this no-annual-fee credit card. openerSection: Citibank PremierMiles Credit Card is one of the best offerings in the credit card market of India in the travel category. If you're a frequent flier (particularly a frequent domestic flier), you can not go wrong with this card. It is a reward points-based card, you earn reward points as AirMiles (or just Miles). Although these Miles can be redeemed for multiple shopping purposes, you get more value on redemption against flight/hotel bookings with partner airlines/hotel chains or on Citibank's PremierMiles portal. These Miles can also be transferred to other airlines/hotel loyalty programs. Citibank gives you 10,000 Miles as a signup benefit and 3000 Miles every year when your card membership is renewed.

You earn 10 Miles for every Rs. 100 spent on flight bookings or on the bank's PremierMiles portal. All other transactions earn you 4 Miles per Rs. 100 spent. Other travel benefits include 32 domestic lounge visits every year with the Visa Signature variant and 24 domestic lounge visits per year with the MasterCard variant. However, you don't get any international lounge access with this credit card. Read on to learn more about Citi PremierMiles Credit Card.

openerSection: Citi Prestige Credit Card is a super premium travel and lifestyle credit card by Citibank. openerSection: The Infinia Credit Card is the most premium product offered by the HDFC bank. Recently, HDFC relaunched the Infinia Credit Card in the metallic variant (all new issuances of the card will now be on the metallic variant). It is an invite-only card. HDFC is targeting HNIs (High Net-Worth Individuals) with this card who want a luxurious lifestyle with exclusive privileges like 24*7 concierge services, access to premium golf destinations, and attractive dining benefits at some of the country's most premium restaurant chains. All these benefits put this card in direct competition with ICICI Bank Emeralde Credit Card, Citibank Prestige Card, and Standard Chartered Ultimate Credit Card.

Keeping the international traveling needs of its premium customers in consideration, HDFC offers a lower foreign currency exchange rate of 2% and a complimentary membership to the Priority Pass program with this card. HDFC Infinia Metal is a Reward Points-based card: you earn 5 Reward Points for every Rs. 150 spent using this card. Although the membership fee for this card is slightly on the higher side, Rs. 12,500/annum, is most certainly worth it and it can be the card of preference for you if you're someone who is financially stable and can not compromise with your lifestyle needs. The Coral credit card also provides an opportunity to earn up to 10,000 bonus Reward Points under its milestone program annually.

Apart from these benefits, the card also offers exciting discounts on movie tickets on Inox & BookMyShow.  Keeping your travel-related requirements in mind, the card provides complimentary domestic airport and railway lounge access every quarter. openerSection: ICICI Bank Emeralde Credit Card is among the most premium offering by the bank and can be considered a tough competitor to the HDFC's Infinia credit card. With this card, ICICI targets HNIs (High Net-Worth Individuals) who frequently go on business trips and don't want to compromise with their lifestyle.

ICICI Bank Emeralde Credit Card offers exclusive benefits like a 24×7 concierge service (that provides assistance regarding hotel/restaurant reservations, flight bookings, car rentals), unlimited complimentary airport lounge access to domestic as well as international terminals, personal air accident insurance cover of Rs. 3 crore, etc. Keeping all the traveling requirements of its premium customers in mind, ICICI charges a nominal foreign currency markup fee of 1.5% on transactions made in a different currency and a zero cash advance fee on cash withdrawals from ATMs.

ICICI Bank used to offer the Emeralde Credit Card in two variants- MasterCard and American Express variants. But since both these payment networks are currently not allowed to onboard new customers, the bank has recently also launched the card on the Visa platform.

One unique feature of ICICI Bank Emeralde Credit Card is that it allows you to choose between two membership plans- the monthly plan, where the cardholders need to pay a monthly fee of Rs. 1,000 and the annual plan with an annual membership fee of Rs. 12,000.

openerSection: ICICI bank has launched this new exclusive co-branded credit card on 20th July, 2021 in collaboration with Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL). This is an addition to the bank's catalog of HPCL credit cards. The unique feature of the Super Saver credit card is that, unlike most other co-branded cards that earn you cashback/rewards only on one particular category of spends, the ICICI Bank HPCL Super Saver Card earns you cash back and/or reward points benefit (as Reward points) on all categories of spends.

openerSection: SBI Card offers two Air India co-branded credit cards- Air India SBI Signature Credit Card and Air India SBI Platinum Credit Card. The Signature variant is more the premium of the two and comes with a higher membership fee of Rs. 4,999 per annum but offers better benefits both in terms of reward points and add-on privileges.

With Air India SBI Signature Credit Card, you can earn 4 reward points per Rs. 100 and accelerated reward points on Air India spends (details below). Being a travel credit card, it also offers complimentary membership to the Priority Pass lounge access program and 2 complimentary domestic airport lounge visits every quarter. Read on to know more about this credit card in detail.

openerSection: Launched by SBI Card in partnership with BPCL, SBI BPCL Credit Card is a co-branded fuel credit. It is an entry-level offering and comes with a nominal membership fee of just Rs. 499 per annum. Being a fuel credit card it provides a total value back of 4.25% (3.25% reward rate and 1% surcharge waiver) on fuel transactions at all BPCL stations.

In addition to fuel benefit, you also get accelerated 5X Reward Points on spends on departmental stores, dining, movies and grocery categories. Since it is an entry-level credit card, you do not get any other value-added travel or lifestyle benefits. Keep reading the article to know more about this card –

openerSection: SBI Card launched BPCL SBI Card Octane in December 2020. It is an upgraded version of the BPCL SBI Credit Card. While the Octane variant does offer better rewards and offers, it also carries a much higher annual fee of Rs. 1,499 whereas the other variant had a fee of Rs. 499 only. BPCL SBI Card Octane gives you 7.25% value back on fuel purchases at Bharat Petroleum fuel stations: 6.25% as reward points (25x reward rate) along with a 1% as fuel surcharge waiver.

You also get 10x reward points for spends on dining and movie tickets apart from the fuel benefits. As far as travel benefits are concerned, the card entitles you with 4 complimentary access to domestic airport lounges every year (max 1 per quarter).

If you travel a lot by car or motorbike, this is probably one of the best offerings in the market right now as you get quite a high reward rate of 6.5% (and 1% surcharge waiver) on fuel spends at all BPCL stations across the country (the 1% surcharge waiver is applicable even at non-BPCL stations). Keep reading to know more about the Octane card.

openerSection: The Cashback SBI Card is a newly launched credit card offered by SBI Card. As the name suggests, the card is a cashback reward card and provides cash back for every transaction down with the card. The card is issued with zero joining fee, however, the annual charges applicable on the card are Rs. 999. With this card, you can earn up to 5% cash back on all online and offline spending made with the card. Apart from this, you get many other benefits like in travel, where you can enjoy complimentary access to domestic airport lounges. The annual fee of the Cashback SBI card might seem a little higher but the same can be waived on spending Rs. 2 Lakh in a year. To know more about the new Cashback SBI Card, go through the review given below:

openerSection: SBI joined hands with Air Vistara and launched two co-branded travel credit cards- Club Vistara SBI Credit Card and Club Vistara SBI Card PRIME. The cards were launched simultaneously in November 2019. These are MasterCard cards that offer travel benefits on Air Vistara airline as CV (Club Vistara) points. You earn 4 CV Points for every Rs. 200 spent using the card. The card also gives you 1 Premium Economy class ticket as a welcome gift on payment of the joining/renewal fee. Although the card does not fall in the premium category, it offers very attractive air insurance benefits where you can get an air accident cover and multiple other air travel-related insurances like insurance cover for loss/delay/damage of the check-in baggage.

openerSection: SBI ELITE Credit Card is a premium credit card by SBI Card and comes with an annual membership fee of Rs. 4,999. It used to be the most premium offering by SBI Card, however, after the launch of the SBI AURUM Credit Card earlier this year, it is now the second most premium credit card offered by SBI Card. Being a premium offering, SBI Bank ELITE Credit Card comes packed with some of the best in class value-added privileges that one expects from a premium credit card including complimentary domestic and international lounge visits, complimentary shopping vouchers, and discounted rates on hotel bookings, free movie tickets and many other add-on benefits.

Talking about this card's reward rate, you earn 2 Rewards on every Rs. 100 purchase with the card (reward rate of 0.5% as 1 Reward Point = Rs. 0.25) and 5X Reward Points per Rs. 100 on departmental stores, dining, and grocery spends (reward rate of 2.5%). SBI ELITE Credit Card comes in three variants- Visa, MasterCard, and American Express variant. While most benefits are the same across all three variants, the payment networks offer some exclusive benefits as well. For example, you get complimentary golf games with the MasterCard variant and discounted dining rates with the AmEx variant of the card. Read on for more information about this premium offering by SBI Card.

openerSection: SBI Cards launched Etihad Guest SBI Card in partnership with the UAE-based airline, Etihad Airways in 2019. It is the lower version of the more premium Etihad Guest SBI Premier Card (also launched at the same event) which offers better benefits and carries a substantially higher annual fee of Rs. 4,999 whereas this card has an annual fee of Rs. 1,499. We have already covered the Premier variant in one of our earlier posts. These cards were launched when the travel industry was at an all time high and travel-related expenses accounted for a substantial portion of the total credit card spends. The card earns you AirMiles at quite a high reward rate on Etihad Airways bookings; you earn decent reward points on other spends as well. Apart from these AirMiles benefits, you also get many other travel-related privileges with this card. To learn more about this card by SBI cards and Etihad Airways keep reading.

openerSection: SBI tied up with the UAE-based Etihad Airways airline and launched two travel credit cards in 2019: Etihad Guest SBI Credit Card and Etihad Guest SBI Premier Card. Needless to say, the Premier version offers more benefits and also carries a higher annual fee. Back then, the travel industry was one of the booming industries in the country. SBI probably launched this card considering that the travel-related spends accounted for 33% of the overall card spends in the SBI credit card portfolio at the time of launch of the card (certainly not the case now, due to the COVID pandemic). Also, Dubai is one of the favorite destinations among Indian travelers as there is a fairly large diaspora of NRIs in Dubai and many Indian HNIs (high net-worth individuals) frequently travel to Dubai on business trips. Etihad Guest SBI Premier card earns you Etihad Airways AirMiles (called Etihad Guest Miles) for every Rs. 100 spent using the card (number of AirMiles earned varies depending upon the category of spends). You also get many travel-related welcome benefits and milestone advantages with the premier card. Keep reading to know more about the card:

openerSection: The IRCTC SBI Card Premier is a co-branded credit card issued by the SBI Card in partnership with irctc.co.in. The card comes with a joining fee of Rs. 1,499 and you get a welcome bonus of 1,500 Reward Points. You can earn up to 3 Reward Points every time you spend Rs. 125. This card also provides you with exclusive travel benefits that include complimentary railway lounge access every year, exciting benefits at over 900 hotels worldwide, saving on railway/flight ticket bookings on irctc.co.in, and many more.

Along with all these exciting offers, you can earn up to 5,000 Reward Points every year on achieving the milestone spend. openerSection: SBI Prime Credit Card is a lifestyle credit card issued by SBI Card. The Prime card carries a membership fee of Rs. 2,999 per annum. Still, SBI Prime Card does offer plenty of value-added benefits like complimentary domestic/international airport lounge access, discounted hotel bookings and movie tickets, etc.

In terms of reward rate, you gain 2 Reward Points per Rs. 100 spent with this card & 10 Reward Points per Rs. 100 for dining, groceries, and departmental store spends. With 1 Reward Point valued at Rs. 0.25, the effective reward rate for the card becomes 2.5% on dining, groceries, and departmental store categories and 0.5% on all other categories of spends.

SBI Card Prime, just like the ELITE Card, is issued in three variants- MasterCard, American Express, and VISA variant. You can get a waiver on this fee if you manage to spend Rs. 5,000 in the previous calendar month. This card provides you with a cashback on online shopping, dining, and travel-related spends. You can get 20% off on Myntra, 10% off Grofers, 10% off on Zomato, and 15% cashback on Ola cab bookings.

On top of this, keeping your entertainment requirements in mind, the card offers a Buy 1 get 1 free (BOGO) offer on Inox under which you can avail of up to 2 complimentary movie tickets monthly. Talking about its travel benefits, you get 20% off on domestic flight bookings, 10% off on international bookings, and up to 25% off on hotel bookings. If you want to know more about this card, keep reading.

openerSection: The Standard Chartered Smart Credit Card, which was launched by the SC Bank in January 2022, is a cashback credit card targeted at low-income individuals or people who are just entering the world of credit cards. It comes with a nominal joining fee of Rs. 499, and provides its customers with a longer interest-free period for the first 90 days after card issuance. Talking about its cashback benefits, you earn 2% cashback on all online transactions and a 1% cashback on offline spends. You can earn up to Rs. 1,500 cashback every month using this card, i.e, up to Rs. 18,000 cashback every year.

Other than this, you can also save the renewal fee of Rs. 499 by spending Rs. 1,20,000 or more in the previous year. With all these amazing saving benefits, the card can be considered best suited for individuals who spend online very often and want to save more on their purchases. To understand the features & benefits, and fees & charges of the Standard Chartered Smart Credit Card in detail, keep reading:

As a welcome benefit, you can earn 100% cashback up to Rs. 1,500 on fuel transactions that you make within the first 90 days after card issuance. Moreover, premium banking customers can also avail themselves of complimentary Priority Pass membership to access more than 1,000 airport lounges. To know more about the card, keep reading.

openerSection: Standard Chartered launched its Ultimate credit card in September 2017. It is the most premium card issued by the bank as of now. It should be the card of choice for individuals having a high income who want to enjoy an elite lifestyle without compromising with their lavish needs. This card is in direct competition with ICICI Bank Sapphiro credit card and HDFC Bank Infinia credit card Metal Edition. Earlier, the card was being offered in two variants- the Visa Infinite variant and MasterCard World variant; the former has now been discontinued though. Since it's a premium card, Standard Chartered offers some of the exclusive benefits to its customers like 24×7 concierge service, golf services, Dreamfolks membership, etc, with this card.

Considering all the international travel requirements of its customers in mind, Standard Chartered has also kept the foreign currency exchange rate at 2% (lower than the average fee of 3.5%) and offers 5% cashback on duty-free purchases at airports. As it is a Reward Points-based credit card, you get 5 Rewards on every Rs. 150 spent using this card, which can be redeemed against shopping vouchers or charity spends under the Standard Chartered 360° rewards program.

openerSection: YES First Preferred credit card is a premium card having premier reward point offers and several other exciting benefits. You can save up to thousands of reward points whenever you make a purchase or pay the annual fee. Not only this, but the card also offers complimentary benefits in travel including domestic as well as international travel lounge access. Get 4 reward points every time you spend Rs. 200 on tax payments, utilities, groceries, etc, and 8 reward points on any other retail purchases. Although the YES First Preferred credit card is a good fit for people who love to save money by earning more and more reward points, it can also be a great choice for people who love traveling. It is because you get 2 domestic lounge access every quarter and 4 exclusive complimentary international lounge access every year. One of its greatest key features is that you get 10,000 reward points on your first transaction if it is done within the first 90 days once you receive the card.
